We now use ~ half a button width.

low touch slop.

title: Fix last unit test
message:
Fix last unit test

Before this change, if a timeout handler added another timeout handler inside of
our time limit, we never ran the new timeout handler.

This change makes us run all timeout handlers until the requested time.

This change also fixes an off-by-one error in our mock timeout handling code,
and removes an erroneous call to verifyNoMoreInteractions().

title: Fix holding-delete behavior
message:
Fix holding-delete behavior

Before this change, when delete was held, we started out by first removing *two*
words, then one at a time.

With this change in place, we remove one word at a time all the time.

title: Make vibration code optimistic
message:
Make vibration code optimistic

So we try to vibrate, and if we get a SecurityException we just log
that.

One beta tester didn't get any vibrations with the previous code where
we attempted to check for permission before vibrating, this is an
attempt at remedying that.

title: Disable on-tap popup; none of the testers like it
message:
Disable on-tap popup; none of the testers like it

It's still there while sliding around the numeric keyboard though, where it's really helpful.

title: Enable floating point warning in Android Studio
message:
Enable floating point warning in Android Studio

It's one of the things complained about by FindBugs, having it already in
Android studio iproves the developer feedback cycle. Yay, feedback cycles!

title: Fix the last FindBugs detected issues
message:
Fix the last FindBugs detected issues

Loss of precision when casting integer division to float after the division is
done.

In this particular case it could sometimes make us be one pixel off, which
probably wasn't the end of the world, but the warning is reasonable and we can
just as well abide by it.

title: Disable unhelpful Android Lint warning
message:
Disable unhelpful Android Lint warning

The ClickableViewAccessibility warning wants ExactypeView to implement / call
View.performClick() to play a sound (but we want to do that ourselves if at
all), report accessibility events (that the keyboard was clicked, but not which
key, which won't help anyone), and call any registered OnClickListener (don't
care, we can do that manually if deemed important in the future).

Feel free to question this reasoning, but until then I'll keep this disabled.

title: KeyInfo.toString(): Explicitly use default locale
message:
KeyInfo.toString(): Explicitly use default locale

The docs say that the default locale is fine for strings intended for human
consumption, and this is one of those.

This remedies an Android Lint warning.

title: Document lack of Findbugs text output
message:
Document lack of Findbugs text output

It's broken in the Gradle plugin: https://issues.gradle.org/browse/GRADLE-2994

message:

* Can we get failure reports to Gradle's stdout / stderr?
* Tune the rules; the current PMD failures don't help anybody

title: README: Remove Travis build status
message:
README: Remove Travis build status

The Travis build status shows build status for all branches, which makes it unusable for me.

Having builds failing in branches is fine; that's how I do TDD, so I don't want a red blotch warning about that on my front page.

If somebody can tell me how to get Travis build status for the master branch only, I promise I'll put it back.

title: Tune max keyboard height
message:
Tune max keyboard height

It's now at 40% of screen height, down from 50%.

In landscape mode, I think 40% makes more sense than 50.

title: Disable "fullscreen" mode on landscape orientation
message:
Disable "fullscreen" mode on landscape orientation

"Fullscreen" means showing a plain text box instead of the actual UI, and I find
that text box ugly and confusing.

title: Set max height relative to screen
message:
Set max height relative to screen

Before this change we set the max height relative to how much space we got in
the layout process.

However, since we're laid out multiple times, and the constraints we get depend
on what we returned during the last run, doing it that way resulted in us using
only a quarter or so of the screen height and leaving half the screen empty in
portrait mode.

title: Use at most half screen for the keyboard height
message:
Use at most half screen for the keyboard height

We used to take all of the screen, not very useful.

This branch adds a popup keyboard for some keys (a, A, e and E) if you long long

place even after the numeric keyboard pops into view.

actual use case for it so there are no keys utilizing that functionality right
now.

title: Don't replace the GestureDetector
message:
Don't replace the GestureDetector

Before this change we used to replace the GestureDetector when the keyboard
layout changed.

That broke the long press up action though.

Now we only replace the GestureListener when the keyboard changes, and long
pressing and releasing over some number actually works!

Next step is to test this on a real device, update the README and merge to
master!

title: Treat double tap as two single taps
message:
Treat double tap as two single taps

This is only after the full double tap has been detected though, so you get both
taps on the second hit rather than getting one on the first and one on the
second. Room for future improvement, it's in the TODO list.

step is to have the keyboard automatically compute what size it should have and
what font size it should use.
